basics.name: Jeonghoon Park
basics.label: Undergraduate Student
basics.summary: Undergraduate student at UNIST, researching at UAI Lab.

education.institution: Ulsan National Institute of Science and Technology (UNIST)

work.name: Ubiquitous AI Lab (UAI Lab)
work.summary: Research on On-Device AI, Human-Centered AI, and Adaptive & Personalized AI.
highlights: Researching compute-efficient techniques for on-device AI

work.name: Topmath
work.summary: Taught math to students aged 14-19 with personalized instruction.

awards.title: Academic Excellence Award
awards.summary: Awarded for outstanding academic performance during the Fall semester of 2024.

awards.title: Academic Excellence Award
awards.summary: Awarded for outstanding academic performance during the Spring semester of 2025.

_publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
_publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

_publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
_publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

_publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
_publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

_volunteer.summary: Served as a public service agent and volunteer at a community children's center, supporting administrative tasks and providing educational support to students.
highlights: Assisted with center management and child engagement activities
Tutored elementary to high school students across various subjects

projects.name: Pintos Project
projects.summary: Implemented core OS components based on Stanford’s Pintos project: thread scheduling, system calls, user programs, virtual memory (demand paging, swapping, mmap), and extensible file system with indexed allocation. Gained deep insight into OS internals through hands-on implementation.

projects.name: Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP) Solver
projects.summary: Implemented and analyzed classical TSP algorithms (Held-Karp, MST, Greedy, 2-opt) alongside a novel MCMF-based heuristic combining global flow and local refinement. Evaluated solution quality and runtime across diverse datasets.

projects.name: Sorting Algorithm Analysis
projects.summary: Implemented and benchmarked 12 sorting algorithms under various input types and data conditions, analyzing performance, stability, and memory usage.
highlights: Analysis on stability and memory usage

projects.name: TinyLLM - UAI Lab
projects.summary: Investigated lightweight LLMs for on-device use. Evaluated accuracy and inference time of each model through various evaluation sets, exploring the tradeoffs in size, latency, and performance.
highlights: Evaluation of small LLMs in constrained environments
Trade-off analysis for on-device use cases
